title: Gatsby English
description: Kick off your next, great Gatsby project with this default-starter-intl. This barebones starter ships with the main Gatsby configuration files you might need.
author: @wiziple

hero.job_description: I enjoy crafting coherent, accessible and intuitive digital projects with pixels and code.

about.title: About Me
about.intro: Hello ! My name is Antonin Nhek, I am a Graphic Designer based in Lyon, France. After years of graphics and a period of absence in the communication field, I made a professional reconversion to turn to programming in January 2019.
about.text1: I started with the bootcamp 'The Hacking Project' where I learned the core concepts of programming and back-end development, algorithmics, peer-programming and peer-learning. I practiced the Ruby language, used Rails framework and manipulated SQL databases. It was also the ideal environment for setting up a daily learning dynamic, developing my communication and teamwork skills.
about.text2: Being as much attracted by design as programming, front-end development was naturally the way to go for me. So I continued my self-taught programming journey with HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript, React and Gatsby. I took classes on Udemy, freeCodeCamp, of Mosh Hamedani, Wes Bos and others gleaned on the Web.
about.text3: I did the #100DaysOfCode challenge on Twitter which consisted in publishing your daily development progress. It has opened me to a world wide supportive community. I also participated to Hacktoberfest 2019 which was the first time I contributed to open source projects.
about.text4: In addition to the field of tech, I'm immersed in the culture Hip-Hop since my teens, I love Beyond Meat burgers, Last.fm, Pinterest and Spotify. I do calisthenics, break-dance, climbing, I like to play Nintendo Switch and card games with my friends.
about.text5: I'm currently looking for an junior front-end developer position. I'd be happy to bring my skills and vision in your team. I'm willing to relocate in Europe.

notfound.description: You just hit a route that doesn't exist... the sadness.
